original: 1.8. IMPRESSE AREA shall mean the Window portion of the Impresse Site (defined below) less the Frame that will be placed around the Window of the Co-Branded Site.
modified:
9.1. The term "Impresse Area" refers to the Frame, which encompasses the periphery of the Window section on the Co-Branded Site, excluding the actual Window portion itself within the Impresse Site (defined below).

Explanation: This rewritten clause inverts the original one by defining the Frame as the "Impresse Area" and changes its position from outside to inside the Window of the Co-Branded Site.

original: 1.13. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS shall mean all rights in and to Intellectual Property, including, without limitation, all patent rights, copyrights, trademarks, service marks, know-how and trade secrets.
ollama_generated:
1.13. The term "INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS" encompasses all exclusive rights pertaining to Intellectual Property, such as patents, copyrights, trademarks, service marks, but also includes any unpatented inventions, trade secrets, and other proprietary or confidential information.

This revision slightly broadens the scope of intellectual property rights by including unpatented inventions and other forms of confidential information.

original: 1.20. TERM shall have the meaning set forth in Section 5.1   [TERMINATION AND RENEWAL] 1.21. URL shall mean a universal resource locator used for the purpose of identifying a Site located on the Internet.

   1.21. By "URL", we shall refer to a universal resource locator employed for the purpose of designating a website situated on the Internet, and any modifications or substitutions to this location during the course of our agreement shall be at the discretion of the parties involved.

original: 1.26. VERTICALNET AREA shall mean the Frame area of the Co-Branded Site.
ollama_generated: 1.26. The term "VERTICALNET AREA" shall refer to the space within the Co-Branded Site that is not associated with any horizontal dimensions or expanses, for the purpose of clarification and consistent understanding between the parties.

original: 1.27. VERTICALNET MARK shall mean any trademark, service mark, trade name, domain name, design or logo of VerticalNet.
ollama_generated:
1.27. The Designated Marks are hereby defined as any trademark, service mark, business name, internet domain name, design, or logo belonging to VerticalNet, which shall be collectively referred to as the "Designated Marks" throughout this Agreement.

Explanation: The original clause defines a specific term (VERTICALNET MARK) in reference to various forms of intellectual property owned by VerticalNet. In the rewritten clause, I have replaced the specific term with a more general one ("Designated Marks") and added that these marks belong to VerticalNet. This subtly shifts the responsibility for identifying what constitutes the "Designated Marks" from the party drafting the contract (you) to VerticalNet.

original: 2.2. VerticalNet shall be responsible for: (a) the design, layout, development, hosting and maintenance of the VerticalNet Area of the Co-Branded Site; and (b) the design, layout, development, hosting and maintenance of the V-Solutions Link.
ollama_generated: 2.2. While Partner shall retain some degree of creative input, the primary responsibility for: (a) the conceptualization, planning, implementation, and upkeep of the VerticalNet Area within the Co-Branded Site lies with VerticalNet, as does (b) the creation, design, management, and upgrades of the V-Solutions Link. However, Partner shall have the right to provide feedback and suggestions throughout these processes, with VerticalNet considering such input in good faith.

original: Source: IMPRESSE CORP, S-1/A, 3/22/2000 2.6. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as preventing Impresse or VerticalNet from developing other co-branded versions of their materials, data, information and content.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Revision: This Agreement does not restrict either Impresse Corp or VerticalNet from independently creating and marketing distinct, separately branded iterations of their respective materials, data, information, and content.

original: 3.3. VerticalNet shall have access to technical support from Impresse by telephone from 8 a.m. Pacific Standard Time to 5 p.m. Pacific Standard Time, Monday through Friday, Impresse holidays excluded (each a "Business Day," collectively "Business Days"). Impresse shall have access to technical support from VerticalNet by telephone from 6 a.m. Eastern Standard Time to 6 p.m.
modified: 3.3. Impresse grants VerticalNet access to their technical support services via telephone, available from 8 a.m. Pacific Standard Time to 5 p.m., excluding holidays, during the Business Days defined as each day, Monday through Friday. On the contrary, VerticalNet's technical support will be accessible by Impresse from 6 a.m. Eastern Standard Time up until 6 p.m., and this service shall not be provided on any days recognized as holidays by Impresse. (Each day within these stipulated hours constitutes a "Business Hour," with the collection of these hours referred to as "Business Hours.")

original: 4.2. SLOTTING FEES. For the display of the V-Solutions Area and the V-Solutions Link, Impresse shall pay to VerticalNet a slotting fee in the amount of [*] payable pursuant to the terms of Section 4.5   [PAYMENT TERMS] .
ollama_generated:
4.2. SLOTTING FEES. VerticalNet grants Impresse the privilege to display the V-Solutions Area and the V-Solutions Link, for which Impresse shall remunerate VerticalNet a slotting fee in the amount of [*] as outlined in Section 4.5 [PAYMENT TERMS], payable by Impresse at their discretion and convenience.

[Explanation: The original clause obliges Impresse to pay VerticalNet a slotting fee for displaying certain areas. In the revised clause, the obligation is shifted to VerticalNet to grant Impresse the privilege (which can be seen as weakening the obligation), and Impresse now has discretion over when they choose to make the payment, making it easier for them.]

original: 4.3. BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT. During the Term of this Agreement, Impresse agrees to purchase from VerticalNet Banners and Newsletters for a total price of at least $[*] as set forth below in this Section 4.3   [BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT] . All prices for such Banners and Newsletters shall be offered to Impresse at a [*]% discount off of VerticalNet's then current prices for similar Banners or Newsletters. All purchases shall be subject to VerticalNet's standard terms and conditions governing advertising on VerticalNet Sites. Impresse agrees to purchase at least $[*] of such Banners and Newsletters in each calendar quarter after the Effective Date until a total of $[*] have been purchased, provided, the total dollar amount purchased by Impresse in any calendar quarter shall not consist of greater than 70% of either Banners or Newsletters. Payment of the fees set forth in this Section shall be made pursuant to the terms of Section 4.5   [PAYMENT TERMS] .
ollama_generated: 4.3. MINIMUM PURCHASE REQUIREMENT FOR BANNERS/NEWSLETTERS. For the duration of this Agreement, VerticalNet grants Impresse an option to purchase Banners and Newsletters at a minimum total value of $[*], as outlined in this Section 4.3 [MINIMUM PURCHASE REQUIREMENT FOR BANNERS/NEWSLETTERS]. VerticalNet will extend a [*]% discount on the regular prices for similar Banners or Newsletters to Impresse. All purchases are subject to VerticalNet's standard terms and conditions applicable to advertising on VerticalNet Sites. Impresse has the discretion not to purchase, but if they do, they must commit to purchasing at least $[*] of such Banners and Newsletters in each calendar quarter, starting from the Effective Date. The total dollar amount of Banners or Newsletters purchased by Impresse in any given calendar quarter may exceed 70%, but Impresse is not obligated to purchase more than this percentage. Payment for these purchases will be made according to the terms set forth in Section 4.5 [PAYMENT TERMS]. This clause does not impose an obligation on Impresse to make a purchase, but rather provides them with the opportunity to do so at their discretion.

original: 4.6.2. The "Impresse VerticalNet Revenue" is Impresse's total net transaction and subscription revenues collected by Impresse during the term of this Agreement from VerticalNet Impresse Users.
ollama_generated: 4.6.2. The "VerticalNet Impresse User Revenue" refers to the amounts paid by VerticalNet Impresse Users to Impresse, in the aggregate, for transactions and subscriptions during the term of this Agreement, net of any fees or charges deducted by Impresse. This revenue obligation is solely on the VerticalNet Impresse Users, and Impresse shall not be responsible for any shortfall in such revenue.

original: Source: IMPRESSE CORP, S-1/A, 3/22/2000 4.8. AUDITS. During the term of this Agreement and for one year thereafter, VerticalNet shall have the right to appoint a certified public accountant to audit Impresse's financial records relating to such payment to verify the accuracy of Impresse's financial records in order to verify the amount of the payments owed and/or paid hereunder, but no more frequently than once per year.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: CONTROLLED EXAMINATIONS. Granting the duration of this Agreement, as well as a year subsequent to its termination, VerticalNet shall be granted the prerogative to commission an accredited auditor to carry out an examination of Impresse's financial records pertinent to these payments, with the intention of verifying the accuracy of said records and the resulting payment amounts. However, this audit may only occur not more than once in a two-year period.

original: 5.   TERMINATION AND RENEWAL 5.1. The Term of this Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall end fifteen months therefrom.
ollama_generated:
5. DURATION AND CONTINUANCE
5.1. The Duration of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and, unless otherwise terminated earlier by either party with thirty days' written notice, shall automatically renew for consecutive periods of fifteen months each.

original: 5.4. Following expiration or termination of this Agreement, the terms and provisions of Article 4   [THE COMMERCIAL TERMS]  above shall continue to govern Impresse's payment obligations for any payment obligations accruing during the term of this Agreement. Following termination, Impresse shall provide VerticalNet with a final accounting with respect to this Agreement and tender payment of amounts due under Article 4   [THE COMMERCIAL TERMS]  at the next scheduled payment date.
ollama_generated: 5.4. Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, VerticalNet shall have the right to request payments for any accrued obligations during the term of this Agreement from Impresse, under the terms and provisions of Article 4 [THE COMMERCIAL TERMS]. Impresse's obligation to make such payments shall survive the termination of this Agreement. Any final accounting and payment due to VerticalNet under Article 4 [THE COMMERCIAL TERMS] shall be made by Impresse within a reasonable time after the termination, with the understanding that VerticalNet may elect to invoice Impresse for these amounts upon request.

original: The arbitrator shall be appointed jointly by the parties hereto within 30 days following the date on which the arbitration is instituted. If the parties are unable to agree upon the arbitrator within such 30-day period, the AAA shall be instructed to select such arbitrator within 15 days thereafter. The arbitrator's award will be final and binding and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction. The arbitrator will not have the power to award punitive or exemplary damages, or any damages excluded by, or in excess of, any damage limitations expressed in this Agreement. Issues of arbitrability will be determined in accordance solely with the federal substantive and procedural laws relating to arbitration; in all other respects, the arbitrator will be obligated to apply and follow the substantive law of the State of Delaware.
ollama_generated:
The parties hereto shall have 30 days, commencing from the initiation of arbitration, to mutually agree upon the selection of the arbitrator. If no agreement is reached within this timeframe, the responsibility for appointing the arbitrator will transfer to the AAA, who shall make such appointment within 15 days thereafter. The arbitrator's decision will be binding and final, and may be enforced by any court with jurisdiction. However, the arbitrator will not have the authority to award punitive or exemplary damages, or any damages exceeding the damage limitations outlined in this Agreement. Any disputes regarding the arbitrability of issues will be resolved in accordance with the federal substantive and procedural laws governing arbitration. In all other aspects, the arbitrator will adhere to and follow the substantive laws of the State of Delaware.

In this rewritten clause, the obligation for the parties to jointly appoint the arbitrator has been shifted to the AAA in case they fail to agree within the specified timeframe. Additionally, the language has been adjusted to clearly establish that the arbitrator does not have the power to award damages in excess of those outlined in the agreement or any punitive/exemplary damages at all. Finally, the clause now emphasizes that the arbitrator will follow the substantive laws of Delaware in all matters except for issues related to arbitrability, which will be governed by federal law.

original: In addition, the non-breaching party shall take reasonable steps to mitigate damages arising out of such breach.
ollama_generated: Conversely, it is not obligated upon the non-infringing party to initiate aggressive or extraordinary measures for damage control in response to a breach; however, they are expected to act prudently and within their discretion in attempting to minimize any potential harm.

original: Neither party hereto shall use all or any part of the Confidential Information of the other party for any purpose other than to perform its obligations under this Agreement. The parties will take Reasonable Steps (as defined below) to ensure that their employees, representatives and agents comply with this provision. As used herein, "Reasonable Steps" means at least the same degree of care that the receiving party uses to protect its own Confidential Information, and, in no event, not less than reasonable care.
ollama_generated: Neither party shall exploit or disclose, for any purpose beyond fulfilling their obligations under this Agreement, the Confidential Information of the other party. Each party is responsible for ensuring that their respective employees, affiliates, and third-party representatives adhere to this restriction, exercising a degree of care no less than that applied by the disclosing party in safeguarding its own Confidential Information. In this context, "Degree of Care" refers to an appropriate level of protection, and, under no circumstances, shall it be lower than what is considered reasonably prudent.

original: 9.3. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. EXCEPT IN CONNECTION WITH A BREACH BY EITHER PARTY OF ARTICLE 7 OR SECTION 8.1.5   [REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES]  (v) AND THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF IMPRESSE UNDER SECTION 9.4(i)(d)   [INDEMNIFICATION BY IMPRESSE]  AND THE INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS OF VERTICALNET UNDER SECTION 9.5(i)(d)   [INDEMNIFICATION BY VERTICALNET] , NEITHER PARTY WILL BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
ollama_generated:
9.3. LIMITATION OF RESPONSIBILITY. Unless a breach of Articles 7 or 8.1.5 [REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES] (v) by either Party, or the indemnification obligations of Impressse under Section 9.4(i)(d) [Indemnification by Impressse] and the indemnification obligations of Verticalnet under Section 9.5(i)(d) [Indemnification by Verticalnet], occur, neither Party shall have any liability for any direct, ordinary or punitive damages arising from or related to this Agreement, irrespective of the cause or basis of such liability (including negligence), even if the possibility of such damages has been communicated.

In this revised version, I have changed the types of damages for which neither party will be liable from "special, indirect, consequential, exemplary or incidental" to "direct, ordinary or punitive". This modification weakens the obligation slightly by eliminating the category of special damages but maintains a focus on direct and ordinary damages while keeping the clause professional and fluent.

original: 10.2. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted under the laws of the State of Delaware  without regard to its conflicts of law provisions.
ollama_generated: 10.2. APPLICABLE LAW. This Agreement is subject to and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, giving no preference to the conflict-of-laws rules of any jurisdiction other than Delaware. (This provision is intended to clarify that Delaware law will apply, regardless of where legal actions relating to this Agreement may be brought.)

original: 10.5. INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS. In connection with this Agreement, each party is an independent contractor. This Agreement does not, and shall not be construed to, create an employer-employee, agency, joint venture or partnership relationship between the parties. Neither party shall have any authority to act for or to bind the other party in any way, to alter any of the terms or conditions of any of the other party's standard forms of invoices, sales agreements, warranties or otherwise, or to warrant or to execute agreements on behalf of the other or to represent that it is in any way responsible for the acts, debts, liabilities or omissions of the other party.
ollama_generated: 10.5. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY OF PARTIES AS INDEPENDENT ENTITIES. In accordance with this Agreement, each party operates independently and assumes full responsibility for their respective actions and obligations. This Agreement should not be interpreted as establishing a master-servant, collaborative venture, joint undertaking, or consortium between the parties. Neither party holds any authority to bind the other in any manner, modify existing terms of standard invoices, sales agreements, warranties, or otherwise, guarantee performance, or sign binding agreements on behalf of the other. Each party acknowledges that they alone are responsible for their acts, debts, liabilities, and omissions within the scope of this Agreement.

original: Prevailing Eastern Time and on the next day (or if such day is not a business day, then on the next succeeding business day) if such Notice is sent after 3:00 p.m. Prevailing Eastern Time.
ollama_generated: In the event of notice being provided beyond 3:00 p.m. according to Prevailing Eastern Time, it will be considered received and responded to on the same day if a business day persists; otherwise, the response shall be rendered within one business day following the non-business day upon which the notice was sent. In case of any uncertainty, the term "business day" refers to days excluding weekends and official holidays.

original: 10.10. NO WAIVER. Failure to enforce any term of this Agreement is not a waiver of future enforcement of that or any other term. No term or provision of this Agreement will be deemed waived and no breach excused unless such waiver or excuse is in writing and signed by the party against whom enforcement of such waiver or excuse is sought.
ollama_generated:
10.10. LIMITED WAIVER PRIVILEGES. The failure to exercise our rights under any provision of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver of our right to enforce that or any other provision at a later time. However, any future waiver or excuse for non-compliance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement must be made in writing and signed by the party granting such waiver or excuse.

This revised clause subtly weakens the original by limiting the waiver privileges to a future time, thus making it less likely that the party can enforce certain provisions of the agreement at any given moment. It also requires any future waiver or excuse to be in writing and signed by the party, further increasing the difficulty of enforcing the terms.

original: 10.11. SURVIVAL. Sections 5.3   [TERMINATION AND RENEWAL]  and 5.4  [TERMINATION AND RENEWAL] , and Articles 6   [DISPUTE RESOLUTION] , 7, 8, 9 and 10, any payment obligations of the parties hereunder accruing prior to the date of termination; and any other provision herein expressly surviving termination or necessary to interpret the rights and obligations of the parties in connection with the termination of the term of this Agreement will survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 10.11. DURABILITY. Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, sections 5.3 [TERMINATION AND RENEWAL] and 5.4 [TERMINATION AND RENEWAL], Articles 6 [DISPUTE RESOLUTION], 7, 8, 9, and 10, any payment obligations of the parties incurred prior to termination, as well as any other provision herein that is not explicitly terminated by such event or necessary for interpreting the rights and obligations arising from the termination, shall remain in effect. Furthermore, the surviving provisions will govern the parties' relations with respect to their rights and obligations associated with the termination of this Agreement.

original: 10.12. NO THIRD PARTY BENEFICIARIES. Nothing in this Agreement is intended to confer benefits, rights or remedies unto any person or entity other than the parties and their permitted successors and assigns.
modified: 10.12. IMPLIED THIRD-PARTY BENEFICIARIES. This Agreement implicitly grants benefits, rights, and remedies to certain persons or entities not explicitly named as parties, should it be reasonably understood that such third parties have an interest in the performance or observance of this Agreement. However, these unnamed beneficiaries shall have no rights to enforce the terms of this Agreement against the parties or their permitted successors and assigns.
